page.title: 11THE ROADWATER PLAYERS
page.content: THE ROADWATER PLAYERS is an amateur dramatic group who have been using the {village hall}for ten years. You have to be 9 years old or over to join. Every August they have a meeting to decide the next pantomime. They practice 5 nights a week in the hall but they have to be quiet. The money from the tickets goes towards hiring the hall. If you want to join, membership is Â£1.00 and every year you pay Â£1.00 towards the costumes. People organize the show, some sell tickets for the raffle. The people who play in the panto give the prizes. The players do other plays besides the panto and each year they look at three or four books to decide which play to do. This year they performed 'Joking Apart' by Alan Aikbourne. If you want to join you do not have to live in Roadwater.
